title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:21 <Denis> has quit  
00:59 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:53 <rrodriguez> has quit  
04:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis1> has quit  
06:48 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <vmassol> guys, today we need to fix the CI  
09:30 <vmassol> for the 5.1M1 release of monday  
09:30 <vmassol> fix the CI = fix jenkins + have the full build pass  
09:30 <vmassol> note: I'd like to finish the upgrade to htmlcleaner 2.5 this morning though (I'm struggling with it but I'll prevail)  
09:31 <vmassol> (I started it yesterday for the BFD)  
09:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <tmortagne> lost vi translations are now fixed on l10n  
09:53 <tmortagne> releasing 5.0.2  
09:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: with the broken ci you're sure it's ok?  
09:54 <tmortagne> it's more a hope :)  
09:54 <vmassol> :)  
09:54 <tmortagne> I should probably wait a bit  
09:54 <tmortagne> will build all that on my side for now  
09:55 <vmassol> it's probably ok for 5.0.2 since we haven't committed much and it's a bugfix release branch  
09:55 <tmortagne> yes but we committed stuff yesterday and without jenkins mistake would not be seen  
10:19 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <dirk\_schmitt> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <dirk\_schmitt> @tmortgagne: I've you need more infos for XWIKI-9164 - I'm here ;-)  
11:08 <vmassol> dirk\_schmitt: thanks but we have enough :) it seems to be a problem on your side  
11:09 <vmassol> now maybe you're using some old vm files or more generally some old xwiki files  
11:11 <tmortagne> sounds more like HTML header setup in Admin (the page title for example)  
11:11 <tmortagne> since that it stored in XWikiPreference it's easy to keep deprecated stuff when you don't upgrade using DW  
11:20 <dirk\_schmitt> The silly thing I have this in 3 different installations. The reason seams to be the HTTP META INFO. Is somethere documented what the current default value should be ?  
11:21 <tmortagne> dirk\_schmitt: documented not exactly but you can get it from the standard XAR  
11:33 <dirk\_schmitt> O.k. I document the problematic configuration sources in XWIKI-9164  
11:34 <dirk\_schmitt> Thanks for the right advice ;-)  
11:34 <tmortagne> dirk\_schmitt: should be nicer next time if you use DW which is suposed to merge you XWikiPreference (like any other document)  
11:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: any idea what could cause "java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: hudson.remoting.Launcher" on agent 2 ? the version of the jar does not seems to match the root jenkins version but not sure if it's just that  
11:36 <tmortagne> other agents seems ok  
11:37 <tmortagne> (not sure what as been done for jenkins already and what is planned)  
11:38 <tmortagne> and of course looks like all 5.0 test project like agent-2 a lot :)  
11:41 <tmortagne> what I don't understand is that agent-2 does not looks like what's on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-5.0.x/50/console  
11:49 <tmortagne> putting it offline for now  
11:54 <dirk\_schmitt> @tmortagne The Distribution Wizard is a quit new feature - I started an 2.x with xwiki ;-)  
11:55 <tmortagne> yes pretty young feature  
11:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: I updated one agent slave, that's agent2  
11:58 <vmassol> so that's really strange  
11:58 <vmassol> it's the only one that has a slave jar matching the jenkins version :)  
11:58 <vmassol> note that I had seen the exception you noticed on other agents too  
11:59 <vmassol> this is what prompted me to update the agent  
11:59 <vmassol> (agent2)  
11:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: what is really weird to me is that http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-5.0.x/50/console does not refect what is on agent-2  
11:59 <tmortagne> it's not he same version of the jar for example  
11:59 <vmassol> indeed  
11:59 <vmassol> maybe I need to restart the agent  
11:59 <vmassol> I don't think I did  
11:59 <cjd> has quit  
11:59 <vmassol> let me try that  
12:00 <vmassol> the log say http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-2/log  
12:00 <vmassol> Slave.jar version: 2.16  
12:02 <tmortagne> does not looks like a jenkins version  
12:02 <vmassol> ok there's a problem  
12:02 <vmassol> I've discoinetced it and restarted it  
12:02 <vmassol> and I get: http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-2/log  
12:02 <vmassol> ah key issue  
12:03 <tmortagne> I replaced the ip by the domain name in the conf to make sure it was going to the right server  
12:03 <tmortagne> that's probably why  
12:03 <vmassol> ok could you put it back?  
12:04 <tmortagne> I changed all the agents actually since the IP really seems a bad idea IMO  
12:04 <vmassol> ok then change the ssh known hosts  
12:04 <vmassol> let me know when you've done it  
12:05 <tmortagne> cleaning know host file  
12:05 <tmortagne> done  
12:05 <tmortagne> checking other agents  
12:06 <vmassol> ok restarting a2  
12:07 <tmortagne> was the only agent with this issue  
12:07 <vmassol> ok much better now :)  
12:07 <vmassol> Slave.jar version: 2.23  
12:07 <vmassol> :)  
12:07 <tmortagne> how is 2.23 better ?  
12:07 <vmassol> betcause it means we're using the correct slave jar now  
12:08 <tmortagne> isn't it supposed to be the version of jenkins ?  
12:08 <vmassol> sure but I'm guessing there's some other internal version too  
12:08 <vmassol> I'm confident  
12:08 <tmortagne> ok  
12:08 <vmassol> so we need to update all slave jars now  
12:08 <tmortagne> version of the protocol then maybe  
12:08 <vmassol> which is why I pinged infra about some automated way yesterday  
12:09 <vmassol> but in the meantime we could do it manually  
12:09 <vmassol> if we're several to help it should be ok  
12:09 <tmortagne> note that most of the other seems to work for now  
12:09 <vmassol> well I had seen problems with others too  
12:09 <tmortagne> anyway can only be better to have the right version  
12:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: could you remaing me the wget URL ?  
12:10 <vmassol> yep  
12:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <tmortagne> ha found it  
12:10 <tmortagne>  http://ci.xwiki.org/jnlpJars/slave.jar  
12:11 <vmassol> yes  
12:11 <vmassol> doing a1  
12:11 <vmassol> so we need to stop and restart agent after each change  
12:11 <tmortagne> ok doing it the opposite way then, a13  
12:12 <tmortagne> should we left it as slave.jar or put the verison of jenkins like the old ones ?  
12:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm removing the old ones  
12:12 <vmassol> I put the version  
12:12 <vmassol> and create a symink  
12:12 <tmortagne> ok some same as old jars  
12:13 <vmassol> a1 done  
12:14 <vmassol> (and restarted)  
12:14 <vmassol> which one are you doing?  
12:14 <vmassol> sorry  
12:14 <vmassol> just seen  
12:14 <vmassol> startign a3  
12:15 <vmassol> a3 done  
12:15 <vmassol> starting a4  
12:16 <tmortagne> 13 done  
12:17 <vmassol> you probably killed the job :)  
12:17 <vmassol> there was a job on a13  
12:17 <vmassol> a4 done  
12:17 <tmortagne> a12  
12:17 <vmassol> starting a5  
12:18 <vmassol> a5 done  
12:18 <vmassol> startign a6  
12:19 <tmortagne> 11  
12:20 <vmassol> btw jenkins guys have fixed my issue with the dahsboard  
12:20 <vmassol> (supposedly, I still need to verify it's fixed)  
12:20 <vmassol> (ah but you know, you're on that skype channel ;))  
12:20 <tmortagne> 10  
12:20 <vmassol> 7  
12:20 <vmassol> ah not 7  
12:20 <vmassol> :)  
12:21 <vmassol> 9  
12:21 <tmortagne> 7 and 8 are windows stuff  
12:23 <vmassol> a9 done  
12:24 <tmortagne> what is xwiki-platform-pullrequests job supposed to be ?  
12:24 <tmortagne> never seen it working  
12:25 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
12:37 <mflorea> has quit  
12:41 <tmortagne> starting 5.0.2 release is 1 or 2 h (lunch time)  
12:53 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol , I am trying to reproduce XWIKI-9150 but I don't understand much from it  
12:55 <sburjan> also from the comments... I don't understand almost anything  
12:56 <sburjan> I don't see any steps to reproduce  
13:03 <vmassol> sburjan: commented  
13:04 <sburjan> vmassol, and how do I switch to domain mode instead of path based ?  
13:04 <vmassol> you don't  
13:05 <vmassol> it's not a domain based setup  
13:05 <vmassol> it's path based  
13:05 <sburjan> then I don't understand from your comment what is the issue. AFAIK path based is the new default  
13:06 <sburjan> so accessing  http://my.domain.com/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome is like accessing localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
13:06 <sburjan> what is the difference ?  
13:06 <vmassol> a bug  
13:06 <vmassol> that's the difference  
13:06 <vmassol> that's why we fixed it  
13:07 <vmassol> (obviously)  
13:07 <sburjan> a bug where ? I am able to access localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
13:07 <vmassol> sigh  
13:07 <vmassol> is the issue about localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome ?  
13:07 <vmassol> of course not  
13:08 <sburjan> o, you could have told me it're related to URL :)  
13:08 <vmassol> I said it  
13:08 <sburjan> so I guess a simple test yould be to add a line in my hosts file ?  
13:08 <vmassol> for ex yes  
13:08 <vmassol> try it in 5.0.1  
13:08 <vmassol> to verify it fails  
13:08 <vmassol> if you want to be sure  
13:08 <sburjan> ok, thanks. I never tampered my hosts file, let's see how it goes :)  
13:09 <sburjan> so in my hosts file I add a host pointing to localhost ?  
13:09 <sburjan> sorinello.xwiki.com -> localhost ?  
13:10 <sburjan> I'm gonna google it. thanks  
13:10 <vmassol> m   
13:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you notice that a rendering test is fialing: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Rendering/job/xwiki-rendering/org.xwiki.rendering$xwiki-rendering-macro-html/1325/testReport/org.xwiki.rendering.test.integration/RenderingTest/macrohtml2\_test\_\_xwiki\_2\_0\_\_event\_1\_0\_/  
13:11 <vmassol> do you know why? (before I start debugging it)  
13:12 <vmassol> hmm  
13:12 <vmassol> seems it started to fail after my upgrade to html cleaner  
13:12 <vmassol> checking  
13:17 <vmassol> sburjan: the best is to find the email from users who were having problems and verify that their problem is solved  
13:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have to go for 1 hour, I'll fix the rendering issue when I'm back  
13:24 <sburjan> vmassol: can't find any e-mail on devlist or userlist  
13:24 <sburjan> (regarding this)  
13:37 <dirk\_schmitt> has quit  
13:44 <sburjan> vmassol, tmortagne : I am unable to reproduce on 5.0.1. I am missing something  
13:58 <tmortagne> sburjan: in 5.0 by default you are supposed to end up on the main wiki when the wiki you are targeting does not exist  
13:59 <tmortagne> but this was not working  
13:59 <tmortagne> look at the documentation of the property  
13:59 <tmortagne> in xwiki.cfg  
13:59 <sburjan> vmassol,: didn't mention anything about this in his comment on the issue .....  
13:59 <tmortagne> looking at the issue  
14:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: vmassol comment imply that you access ou wiki with a domain which is not associated to the main wiki  
14:01 <tmortagne> which technically is exactly what I explained: the wiki associated to this domain can't be found  
14:01 <sburjan> ok, but I still don;t know how to reproduce ? do I need a XEM ?  
14:01 <tmortagne> so you need to do exactly what vmassol suggest, access your with the suggested domain  
14:01 <tmortagne> no you don't  
14:02 <tmortagne> just do exactly what vmassol suggest  
14:02 <sburjan> I have a jetty+hsqldb  .. on 5.0.1 final, added a host in my /etc/hosts, and I am able to access the wiki  
14:02 <sburjan> so I must be missing something  
14:03 <tmortagne> what domain are you using ?  
14:03 <tmortagne> you can also try a path based URL  
14:03 <tmortagne> it's the same issue  
14:03 <tmortagne> basically whatever you type you are supposed to end up on main wiki  
14:04 <sburjan> in my /etc/hosts I have added a new line: 127.0.0.1 sorinello.artanis.com Artanis  
14:04 <tmortagne> so try all the ways listed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/AccessWiki  
14:04 <sburjan> and I am accessing the wiki using: http://sorinello.artanis.com:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
14:04 <tmortagne> to fix the bug I tested with path based URL  
14:04 <sburjan> path based is the default, so this is also what I have  
14:04 <tmortagne> no it's not  
14:05 <tmortagne> it's not because it's enabled that you are using it  
14:05 <tmortagne> I don't see anthing in your URL that indicate the wiki so no it's not path based URL  
14:05 <tmortagne> please see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/AccessWiki  
14:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <sburjan> this document is very confusing.  I don;t know what xwiki virtual mode is and this document does not explain it.  
14:20 <Slashman> has quit  
14:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <npm> has quit  
15:02 <sburjan> tmortagne, so a jetty+hsqldb doesn't have either URL nor path based access ?  
15:04 <sburjan> \*domain nor path based  
15:06 <tmortagne> sburjan: virtual mode is how multiwiki is called everywhere in XWiki, for example you have xwiki.virtual property  
15:10 <sburjan> tmortagne, I see in xwiki.cfg that :#-# Starting with XWiki 5.0M2, virtual mode is enabled by default.:  
15:10 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <vmassol> lots of red to fix on http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/  
15:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: and ?  
15:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: this might be for you http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform/3893/consoleText  
15:11 <vmassol> compilation error  
15:12 <sburjan> tmortagne, but the URL I am redirected when I access my wiki is "http://sorinello.artanis.com:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/" I dont' see any XWiki descriptor here  
15:13 <vmassol> sburjan: hold on I'm going to update the documentation  
15:13 <vmassol> once I've done that I'll ping you  
15:13 <sburjan> vmassol, thanks, I'm TOTALLY confused ATM  
15:14 <sburjan> and can't help you test it if I don't understand it  
15:14 <vmassol> tmortagne and all: wdyt of dropping the term "virtual wiki" and "virtualization" in our doc in favor of either "multiwiki" or "multi tenancy"?  
15:14 <vmassol> multi tenancy is the official term AFAIK  
15:14 <vmassol> (for the feature of running several wikis on the same JVM)  
15:14 <sburjan> +1, since virtual wiki always confuses me even after 3 years of using xwiki :)  
15:21 <tmortagne> [starting the 5.0.2 release]  
15:31 <tmortagne> actually looks like there is a real failing test on xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium-5.0.x  
15:33 <tmortagne> bu without any real change...  
15:53 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <rrodriguez> has quit  
16:18 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <vmassol> sburjan: ok I'm done, so the entry point for multi tenancy is http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/ScalabilityPerformance  
16:29 <vmassol> let me know if you can understand it  
16:29 <sburjan> vmassol, starting the lecture :)  
16:32 <qwebirc8994> has joined #xwiki  
16:35 <qwebirc8994> has quit  
16:36 <evandroNogueira> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <sburjan> vmassol, I still have one question which I don't understand. If I download an XE 5.0.1 (jetty+hsqldb). Since  5.0.1 is newer than 5.0, it means it has xwiki.virtual =1 (because this is now the default)  
16:36 <sburjan> and I correct until this point ?  
16:37 <sburjan> also, in xwiki.cfg comments I see "#-# Starting with XWiki 5.0M2, virtual mode is enabled by default."  
16:38 <vmassol> sburjan: I guess you reached http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Virtualization right?  
16:39 <sburjan> vmassol, yes. And seeing the section "Prior to 5.0", I assume that starting 5.0 is the other way around  
16:39 <vmassol> so it means you've seen http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Virtualization#HConfigurationpriortoXWiki5.0  
16:39 <vmassol> yep  
16:39 <vmassol> what's not clear?  
16:40 <sburjan> I didn't reached yet the unclear part. Ok, so if this is enabled by default, it means that is my XWiki instance is configured out of the box to be a farm/XEM, right ?  
16:40 <sburjan> \*/is/if  
16:40 <sburjan> I am asking in baby steps  here  
16:41 <evandroNogueira> Hi everbody, I am having a problem when turning on annotations in XWiki 5.0.1 in Jboss.  
16:42 <tmortagne> sburjan: "by default" is not the right word, XWiki is always in multiwiki mode starting with 5.0, you can't disable it  
16:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't anser please  
16:42 <vmassol> answer  
16:42 <vmassol> I'm udpating the doc  
16:42 <vmassol> and I'd like to validate it  
16:42 <vmassol> on sorin  
16:42 <vmassol> :)  
16:42 <sburjan> :)  
16:43 <vmassol> sburjan: is it better now: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Virtualization ?  
16:43 <sburjan> vmassol, : re-reading.  
16:44 <tmortagne> vmassol: you should avoid "by default" which is very misleading IMO, it imply that there is still two modes and you can disable it  
16:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: fixed  
16:47 <sburjan> vmassol,: I'd add: mode since it's a builtin feature [enabled out of the box].  
16:47 <vmassol> mode?  
16:47 <vmassol> there' s no mode  
16:47 <vmassol> since it's builtin  
16:48 <vmassol> there's no enabling either  
16:48 <sburjan> There's no special step to take to configure XWiki in multi-tenant mode since it's a builtin feature.  
16:48 <sburjan> your words :)  
16:48 <vmassol> yes  
16:48 <vmassol> exactly  
16:48 <vmassol> what's wrong with that?  
16:48 <vmassol> fixing slightly....  
16:49 <sburjan> I simple user (me) doesn't assume the feature is enabled/working/activated by default. At least I don't assume this from reading this sentence  
16:49 <evandroNogueira> When i try to show annotations, by clicking in the checkbox in the annotations area in a page, the rest api tries to get the adress and show  a error message. The exception in the log is http://pastebin.com/fGTv4Z9D. But, when i put the ip in the adress at the first line, it works.  
16:49 <sburjan> but maybe it's my twisted text interpreter  
16:49 <vmassol> fixed  
16:49 <vmassol> better?  
16:50 <sburjan> vmassol, yes  
16:50 <sburjan> vmassol, now we move to: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/AccessWiki which is the CORE of my confusion  
16:51 <vmassol> ok  
16:52 <sburjan> ok, I understand now. I kept missing reading this: "Note that if no /wiki/wikialias path is found in the URL then XWiki defaults to the domain-based algorithm explained below."  
16:53 <sburjan> shouldn't this be /xwiki/wikialias ?  
16:53 <sburjan> instead of /wiki/wikialias  
16:54 <vmassol> no  
16:54 <vmassol> "The URL format for this mode is: http://host/xwiki/wiki/wikialias/view/Space/Page."  
16:54 <vmassol> "The important part of the URL is /wiki/wikialias."  
17:00 <vmassol> sburjan: so you're good now?  
17:01 <sburjan> vmassol,: just a second settinp up a XEM with WOrkspaces so I can see property the URL  
17:01 <sburjan> after creating the WOrkspace the DW kicks in, this is something new  
17:01 <sburjan> is it normal ?  
17:01 <sburjan> 5.1-SNAPSHOT  
17:02 <sburjan> I cancelled it, and I didn't had to re-import  
17:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: you mean you created a new workspace which is not empty and you get DW ?  
17:03 <sburjan> DW kicked in and told me that there are some documents in the table and then asked what should I do. I had 2 options: New Install, Upgrade. But I clicked cancel DW :)  
17:03 <tmortagne> it does not sounds normal but there is no difference between 5.1 and 5.0 on DW AFAIK  
17:03 <tmortagne> if DW ask you that it's because for some reason it could not find any extension in that workspace  
17:04 <sburjan> let me create another workspace  
17:04 <tmortagne> seems something has been broken either on standard importer or on copyWiki  
17:04 <sburjan> creating workspace "thomas", this didn't exist previously for sure  
17:05 <sburjan> ah wait, it's my bad. I imported the XAR Manually on the Main wiki using superadmin user. I didn't go through DW for installing the Main  
17:05 <sburjan> maybe this is the cause  
17:05 <tmortagne> I don't see why  
17:06 <sburjan> maybe because EM doesn't have a list of installed extensions/descriptors since I manually imported the ui-all xar  
17:06 <tmortagne> the only thing you do on main wiki that would have any impact of subwiki DW is choosing if you want DW on subwikis  
17:06 <tmortagne> sburjan: we are talking about a subwiki here  
17:06 <tmortagne> what you have or don't have on your main wiki is not relevant  
17:07 <sburjan> ok, I see  
17:07 <sburjan> makes sense  
17:07 <tmortagne> and when you import a standard XAR it's registered as extension anyway  
17:07 <tmortagne> and that' why EM is supposed to find it when workspaces creates it  
17:07 <sburjan> ah also i have a snapshot, but I didn't enabled snapshot repos  
17:08 <tmortagne> hmm that would be the reason actually  
17:08 <tmortagne> when standard import can't find matching on any repository for the XAR it's importing it does not register it as extension  
17:08 <tmortagne> so that's probably your issue here  
17:09 <tmortagne> (it's to avoid putting partial information in the extensions index)  
17:10 <sburjan> tmortagne, I see

20:40 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I'm new to xwiki and I have a simple question about the import panel in admin.  
20:41 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I'm doing the FAQ form tutorial, and the first thing you do is import the xwiki .XAR file so that you have some pages.  
20:42 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I downloaded the enterprise xwiki .XAR file and import it, and I get this message:  
20:43 <Frank\_\_\_\_> "An error occurred while importing xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-5.0.2.xar"  
20:44 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I can't find an error log or anything like that, so I am stumped. Google isn't helping me much either.  
20:45 <Frank\_\_\_\_> My xwiki instance is installed on my local PC with Tomcat.  
20:45 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> They should have more details  
20:45 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Search for logs/catalina.out  
20:45 <Frank\_\_\_\_> ah, will do.  
20:46 <Frank\_\_\_\_> Thanks Dumitriu.  You emailed my coworker Mary a couple of days ago, thanks for helping us with all those questions.  
20:47 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Ah, indeed, you're welcome  
20:47 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> I hope the answers were useful  
20:47 <Frank\_\_\_\_> Very much so.  We appreciate it.  
20:49 <Frank\_\_\_\_> This is a windows system, would that log have a different name?  
20:49 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> No, it should be catalina.out  
20:49 <Frank\_\_\_\_> OK, thanks.  
20:50 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> It's been a very long time since I used Tomcat on Windows, so don't take everything I say for granted...  
20:51 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> What database backend did you configure?  
20:51 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I promise you know more about it than I do :)  
20:51 <Frank\_\_\_\_> My local is MySQL.  
20:51 <Frank\_\_\_\_> If we go to a production system we'll use Oracle.  
20:51 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> OK, things to keep in mind is the packet maxsize setting, and the utf8 encoding  
20:52 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Those are the most frequent source of errors  
20:52 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I created my database with the quiery provided in the MySQL tutorial, so I know it's utf8.  
20:52 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Good  
20:53 <Frank\_\_\_\_> packet maxsize, however...  
20:53 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> If you managed to upload the XAR, it should be OK  
20:56 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I'm not sure it uploads, it looks like it's 97% done when the error shows up  
20:57 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I have to leave for a meeting, but I'll let you know what I figure out later.  Thanks again!  
20:57 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Ah, so it could be the maxsize  
20:57 <Frank\_\_\_\_> I'll leave myself a note to check that when I come back.  
20:58 <xwiki\_sdumitriu> Looked it up, the setting name is max\_allowed\_packet

21:55 <Frank\_\_\_\_> max\_allowed\_packet is the winner!  Set to 16M, restart MySQL and it works.  Thanks!  I'll share this with my team.  
21:56 <sdumitriu1> Frank\_\_\_\_: XWiki supports attachments, which you can either store in the database, or on the filesystem  
21:56 <sdumitriu1> If you want to store them in the database, then you have to increase that to more than the maximum size of attachments you'd like to use  
21:56 <sdumitriu1> But it's better to switch to filesystem storage  
21:57 <Frank\_\_\_\_> Right.  And we probably will change that up, we would probably have too many files for DB storage.  
21:57 <sdumitriu1> It's much better for performance, but it adds to the complexity of backups  
22:01 <Frank\_\_\_\_> Congrats on 5.0.2, saw that arrive today.  
22:02 <sdumitriu1> Frank\_\_\_\_: We have instances that have tens of gigabytes of attachments without problems, so it's not really a blocker  
22:05 <Frank\_\_\_\_> Our client may rule it out, we'll see.  Good to know both are options.
